author: Tara Prindiville
description: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he "didn't make any progress" on a potential ceasefire when he spoke by phone with Russian President Vladimir Putin.
title: Trump says call with Putin yielded no progress on a Russia-Ukraine ceasefire

author: Sean Conlon, CNBC
description: U.S. stocks rose on Thursday, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite hitting fresh record highs, after a better-than-expected jobs report fueled optimism the U.S. economy was hanging tough despite fast-changing trade policy and geopolitics
title: Dow jumps more than 300 points, S&P 500 sets new record after strong June jobs report

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: President Donald Trump is expected to sign into law on Friday his sprawling domestic policy bill, which includes nearly $1 trillion in cuts to Medicaid, the government health insurance program for low-income and disabled Americans.
title: ‘A slap in the face’: Georgia and Arkansas’ Medicaid work rules may preview the road ahead

author: Spencer Kimball, CNBC
description: President Donald Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill Act ends long-standing federal support for solar and wind power, while creating a friendly environment for oil, gas and coal production
title: Trump megabill gives the oil industry everything it wants and ends key support for solar and wind

author: Natalie Kainz
description: The Velvet Sundown, an indie psych rock band, has amassed more than 850,000 listeners on Spotify in a matter of weeks — but nobody is exactly sure if it’s real.
title: An indie band is blowing up on Spotify, but people think it's AI

author: Aria Bendix
description: It’s not uncommon for Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: RFK Jr.'s warnings about sperm counts fuel doomsday claims about male fertility

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Justice Department had sought clarification of a Supreme Court decision that allowed the administration to quickly deport immigrants to "third countries."
title: Supreme Court paves the way for Trump to send migrants to South Sudan

author: Doha Madani
description: A 72-year-old man was indicted on a murder charge after new DNA evidence in a decades-old missing person investigation identified the remains of his former girlfriend.
title: Man indicted on murder charge 42 years after his ex-girlfriend went missing

author: Curtis Bunn
description: Sean “Diddy” Combs may be considered a convicted felon following his explosive, seven-week federal trial, but many in and around the music industry said his decadeslong career as a revolutionary producer and hitmaker could grant him a pathway to resume his career.
title: With his ‘mystique’ gone, Diddy’s future in music after trial is uncertain

author: Chloe Atkins
description: The judge presiding over the criminal case against Kilmar Abrego Garcia in Tennessee on Thursday directed both sides to stop making public statements about the case after defense lawyers argued the government was depriving him of his right to a fair trial by making inflammatory comments.
title: Judge orders government to stop making public comments on Kilmar Abrego Garcia's case

author: Ali McCadden, CNBC
description: Americans may spend more on common barbeque items this Fourth of July with prices on products like beer, outdoor folding chairs and grill tools higher, according to a new congressional report
title: Fourth of July barbeque prices have risen since Trump imposed tariffs, congressional analysis says

author: Allan Smith
description: A relatively underappreciated constituency is raising the alarm about President Donald Trump’s “big, beautiful bill” — gamblers
title: Bettors are worried Trump's 'big, beautiful bill' could cause professional gambling in the U.S. to fold

author: Jocelyn Shek
description: Men in the U.S. are spending a record-high amount of time on household activities, though inequalities between men’s and women’s contributions persist.
title: U.S. men are doing more domestic work than ever, but still less than women

author: David K. Li
description: Major League Baseball removed Cleveland Guardians pitcher Luis Ortiz from the team, officials said Thursday, amid an unspecified probe of the right-handed starter
title: Cleveland Guardians pitcher Luis Ortiz removed from team amid ongoing probe

author: Matt Dixon
description: In a new court filing, the Department of Homeland Security says that so far, Florida has not even applied for any federal funds for "Alligator Alcatraz" yet.
title: Despite promises, Florida has so far received no federal money for 'Alligator Alcatraz'

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: Federal immigration agents detained renowned Mexican boxer Julio César Chávez Jr.
title: ICE arrests Mexican boxer Julio César Chávez Jr. in Los Angeles

author: Shreya Srinivasan
description: Just ahead of the Independence Day long weekend, beaches across the country have closed and issued advisories due to excessive levels of harmful bacteria.
title: Dozens of beaches across the U.S. close before July Fourth weekend due to fecal bacteria

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: The Nuggets and Rockets have improved their rosters in free agency while the Lakers and Bucks have made head-scratching moves.
title: NBA free agency: Breaking down the best and worst moves so far this offseason

description: The House narrowly passed Republicans’ sweeping tax and spending bill in a 218-214 vote just ahead of the July 4 deadline. The legislation now heads to President Trump's desk.
title: House passes President Trump's megabill

author: Sahil Kapur
description: The Republican-controlled House passed a multitrillion-dollar tax cuts and spending package, sending the bill to President Donald Trump’s desk.
title: House passes sprawling domestic policy bill, sending it to Trump's desk

author: Jesse Kirsch
description: A New York man went missing in Turks and Caicos, according to authorities from the Caribbean Island.
title: New York man disappears on vacation with wife in Turks and Caicos

author: Gabrielle Fonrouge, CNBC
description: The retail industry is breathing a sigh of relief after it appeared to avoid the worst case scenario on Vietnam tariffs
title: Retailers avoided a worst case scenario in Vietnam. Trump's trade deal could still hit consumers.

description: Speaker Mike Johnson teased Rep. Hakeem Jeffries for his speech in comments on the House floor and jokingly put a giant binder on his lectern to mock Jeffries.
title: Johnson: I'll be 'a little more brief' after Jeffries' marathon speech

author: Denise Chow
description: Astronomers are rolling out a welcome mat for a newly identified visitor from beyond our solar system
title: Interstellar comet is only third known object to visit from beyond our solar system

description: Mike Johnson told NBC News that he doesn’t think the GOP holdouts who eventually voted to advance the bill “caved,” but that they “genuinely needed time to digest.”
title: Mike Johnson says GOP holdouts didn't cave, just 'needed time to digest'

author: Daniel Arkin
description: Michael Madsen, a prolific character actor best known for playing sneering tough guys in Quentin Tarantino's "Reservoir Dogs" and "Kill Bill: Vol.
title: Michael Madsen, 'Reservoir Dogs' and 'Kill Bill: Vol. 2' actor, dies at 67

author: Frank Holland, CNBC
description: In a year when the U.S. consumer has been weighed down by economic uncertainty, geopolitical tensions and inflation, Black entrepreneurs are eager to get to the Essence Festival of Culture to connect with their core customers.“Essence Fest is like my Black Friday,” said Rochelle Ivory, owner of beauty brand On the Edge Baby Hair.
title: Essence Fest leads a summer of events for Black entrepreneurs galvanized by economic uncertainty

author: The Associated Press
description: BERLIN — A man on a long-distance train in southern Germany attacked and slightly injured four people with a hammer Thursday before he was detained by police, authorities said
title: Police say a man injured 4 with a hammer on a German train before he was detained

author: Alicia Victoria Lozano
description: Southern California communities are canceling or rescheduling July 4th events as immigration arrests continue to spread fear across the region.
title: Los Angeles cancels some July Fourth events amid deportation fears

author: The Associated Press
description: An assailant in Finland stabbed several people near a shopping center in the southern city of Tempere on Thursday afternoon, and one person was arrested.
title: Finnish media says several people have been stabbed in the southern city of Tempere

author: Meriam Bouarrouj
description: A man who was promised the "chance of a lifetime" by Guy Fieri filed a lawsuit against the celebrity chef, alleging that the Food Network star's company failed to live up to the offer he made to the winner of his reality show.
title: Guy Fieri reality show winner files lawsuit alleging breach of contract over Chicken Guy! franchise

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Travel woes are likely for Fourth of July revelers with planned trips starting Thursday due to stormy weather.
title: Fourth of July travel woes expected with storms in the Northeast

description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries, D-N.Y., began a speech on the House floor to voice his opposition to President Trump's spending bill. Jeffries told his fellow lawmakers he would "take [his] time" in an effort to delay a final vote on the legislation for as long as possible.
title: 'I'm gonna take my time': Jeffries delays House vote with hourslong speech

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: WASHINGTON — House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries, D-N
title: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries blasts GOP and Trump agenda bill in hourslong floor speech

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A 24-year-old man is facing charges after allegedly working with a transnational terrorist group to create a hit list of "high-value targets" for assassination that included U.S. officials, non-governmental organizations, and leaders of private companies, federal prosecutors said Wednesday.
title: Member of white supremacy group charged in alleged plot to solicit murder of 'high-value targets'

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: Marwan Sultan was still in his white white doctor’s coat when an Israeli bomb killed him, his wife and four children in their home in Gaza City.
title: Israeli strike kills renowned doctor Marwan Sultan and his family amid renewed attacks on healthcare workers

author: Richard Engel
description: Iran's Deputy Foreign Minister Majid Takht-Ravanchi says his country will not retaliate against the United States for attacks against its nuclear program.
title: Iran won't retaliate against U.S. — but will keep enriching uranium, top official says

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court turned away an appeal by Montana officials seeking to revive a state law that requires minors seeking abortions to obtain the consent of their parents.
title: Supreme Court declines to revive Montana law requiring consent for minors to receive abortions

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia was stripped naked, had his head shaved, beaten, forced to kneel for hours overnight, and lost over 30 pounds during his time at the notorious CECOT prison in El Salvador, his attorneys say in a new court filing
title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia suffered psychological and physical torture in El Salvador prison, attorneys say

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court wades into the legal fight over state laws that ban transgender athletes from competing in girls and women’s school and college sports.
title: Supreme Court to rule on state transgender student sports bans

description: U.S. employers added 147,000 jobs in June, easing concerns about the country's economy. The unemployment rate fell from 4.2% to 4.1%, with state government jobs leading the job growth.
title: U.S. economy adds 147,000 jobs in June

author: The Associated Press
description: An estimated 90% of the capital Port-au-Prince is now under control of criminal groups who are expanding attacks into previously peaceful areas, a U.N. official said.
title: Haiti's gangs have 'near-total control' of the capital as violence escalates, U.N. says

author: Mili Godio
description: Fourth of July sales are here. Shop the best deals from Yeti, Apple, Dyson, Samsonite and more.
title: 51+ best 4th of July deals to shop right now

author: Daniella Silva
description: A recent Supreme Court decision puts an expectant immigrant mother in South Carolina and her baby at risk in a way that's not the same for a woman across the border in North Carolina.
title: Two pregnant asylum-seekers in neighboring states face different birthright citizenship challenges

description: As Iran suspends its cooperation with the International Atomic Energy Agency, its deputy foreign minister is speaking out about the damage to his country's nuclear program. NBC's Richard Engel report for TODAY from Tehran.
title: Iran Suspends Cooperation With UN Nuclear Monitoring Agency

author: The Associated Press
description: CHICAGO — Four people have died from gunshot wounds and 14 others have been hospitalized following a drive-by shooting in Chicago, police said Thursday.
title: Drive-by shooting in Chicago leaves 4 dead and 14 others wounded, police say

author: The Associated Press
description: A special tribunal has sentenced Bangladesh’s former leader Sheikh Hasina to six months in jail after she was found in contempt of court for allegedly claiming she had a license to kill at least 227 people.
title: Bangladesh's ousted leader sentenced to six months over a claim she had a license to kill

author: Reuters
description: Viral rumours of impending disaster stemming from a comic book prediction have taken the sheen off Japan‘s tourism boom, with some airlines cancelling flights from Hong Kong, where passenger numbers have plunged.
title: Tourists to Japan spooked after comic book predicts doomsday

author: The Associated Press
description: American contractors guarding aid distribution sites in Gaza are using live ammunition and stun grenades as hungry Palestinians scramble for food, according to accounts and videos obtained by The Associated Press.
title: U.S. contractors tell the AP that their colleagues are shooting at Palestinians seeking food in Gaza

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Lawmakers in the House pulled an all-nighter on the massive domestic policy package for President Donald Trump’s agenda.
title: House to vote on Trump agenda bill and May jobs report expectations: Morning Rundown

description: Before the displays of fireworks, a record number of Americans are taking off for their holiday weekend destinations. While the roads may be packed, drivers will find relief at the pump with the national average price of gas dipping to the lowest level on July Fourth since 2021, according to GasBuddy. NBC’s Emilie Ikeda reports and TODAY’s Dylan Dreyer tracks the latest forecast.
title: Fourth of July Gas Prices Dip to Lowest Level Since 2021

description: After President Donald Trump won over Republican holdouts for his so-called “Big Beautiful Bill,” the spending package is now expected to become law. Democrats protested the bill, saying millions will lose health insurance if it goes into effect. NBC’s Ryan Nobles reports for TODAY.
title: Trump Wins Over GOP Holdouts to Pass Spending Bill

author: Denise Chow
description: Broadacres Marketplace, a North Las Vegas shopping hub, announced it would temporarily close because of the threat of raids by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
title: ICE shut down this Latino market — without even showing up

author: Reuters
description: Kate, Britain’s princess of Wales, said on Wednesday that she had to put on a “brave face” throughout and following her cancer treatment last year, describing the ordeal as a life-changing experience.
title: U.K.'s Princess Kate says she had to 'put on brave face' in cancer journey

author: The Associated Press
description: ESPAÑOLA, N.M. — Clouds build up in the early afternoon and gusty winds push in every direction.
title: Monsoon season brings the promise of rain for the arid southwestern U.S.

description: Watch live coverage as House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries delivers an extended "magic minute" speech as the GOP budget bill moves through the House.
title: House Minority Leader Jeffries delivers marathon speech amid GOP budget bill debate

author: Ariana Brockington, TODAY
description: Arizona police have shared how authorities were able to track down a 5-year-old boy who wandered into the desert with his dog
title: 5-year-old rescued after wandering into the desert with his dog

author: Patrick Smith
description: Diogo Jota, the celebrated Portuguese soccer star who recently won the English Premier League with Liverpool Football Club, has been killed in a car crash, authorities said Thursday
title: Liverpool soccer star Diogo Jota killed in car crash in Spain, police say

author: Rob Wile
description: The U.S. economy continues to send mixed signals.
title: U.S. job growth expected to have slowed in June as economy sends mixed signals

author: Janis Mackey Frayer
description: LIUYANG, China — There are few sights more dazzling than fireworks on the Fourth of July.
title: How the U.S.-China trade war could leave skies dark on the Fourth of July

author: Michael Duarte, NBC Los Angeles
description: Kershaw, now just the 20th pitcher in MLB history to reach 3,000 strikeouts, joins an exclusive pantheon of greatness.
title: Clayton Kershaw carves name into baseball history books with 3,000th career strikeout at Dodger Stadium

author: The Associated Press
description: Fifteen people were taken to a hospital when a skydiving aircraft went off a runway and crashed in the woods near an airport in southern New Jersey on Wednesday evening, according to authorities
title: Skydiving plane goes off New Jersey runway into woods, sending 15 to hospital

description: "The Velvet Sundown" has more than 700,000 monthly listeners on Spotify, but their entire album is being accused of being AI generated. NBC News' Erin McLaughlin has more on potentially AI-generated music.
title: Possible AI band gains thousands of listeners on Spotify

author: Dan De Luce
description: A 2017 intelligence assessment found that Russia waged an information warfare campaign designed to boost Trump’s prospects and damage Hillary Clinton's candidacy.
title: CIA review criticizes procedures but not conclusions of intelligence report on 2016 Russia election interference

author: The Associated Press
description: A federal judge on Wednesday ended an order blocking the deportation of the family of the man charged in the fatal firebomb attack in Boulder, Colorado, noting government lawyers say the man's relatives are not being rushed out of the country as the White House originally stated.
title: Judge ends order blocking deportation of Boulder firebomb attack suspect’s family

author: Phil Helsel
description: A 21-year-old intern in a congressman’s Washington office was fatally shot Monday in the city after gunmen opened fire on a group of people, authorities said
title: Congressional intern killed in Washington shooting
